skill.name: terraform-module-library
skill.description: Build reusable Terraform modules for AWS, Azure, and GCP infrastructure following infrastructure-as-code best practices. Use when creating infrastructure modules, standardizing cloud provisioning, or implementing reusable IaC components.
skill.summary: Build reusable Terraform modules for AWS, Azure, and GCP infrastructure following infrastructure-as-...

security_audit.summary: No data theft or malicious execution patterns were detected. Content is documentation and examples without network or file system access.

content.value_statement: Teams struggle to standardize Terraform modules across clouds. This skill provides patterns, examples, and testing guidance to create reusable modules.
actual_capabilities: Defines a standard Terraform module folder structure
Provides an AWS VPC module example with variables and outputs
Shows module composition with multiple modules
Documents a Terratest example for VPC validation
Lists AWS module patterns for common services
limitations: No runnable module code assets are included in this directory
Azure and GCP reference files are not present
Does not automate deployment or testing

use_cases.title: Standardize AWS modules
use_cases.description: Create consistent Terraform module structures and examples for shared AWS infrastructure.

use_cases.title: Define module best practices
use_cases.description: Set documentation and testing conventions for reusable Terraform modules.

use_cases.title: Plan module composition
use_cases.description: Design how VPC and RDS modules fit together in environments.

prompt_templates.title: Start a module layout
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a standard Terraform module folder structure for an AWS VPC module with examples and tests.

prompt_templates.title: Define module inputs
prompt_templates.prompt: List required and optional variables for an AWS VPC module and include validation guidance.

prompt_templates.title: Add testing guidance
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a Terratest plan for a VPC module, including key assertions and outputs.

prompt_templates.title: Compose multiple modules
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to compose VPC and RDS modules with shared tags and outputs for production.

output_examples.input: Create a reusable AWS VPC module plan.
output: Module layout with main, variables, outputs, versions, examples, and tests

best_practices: Document all inputs and outputs with clear descriptions
Use semantic versioning and pin provider versions
anti_patterns: Mixing environment specific values into module code
Omitting input validation for critical variables

faq.question: Is this compatible with my Terraform version?
faq.answer: Guidance aligns with Terraform 1.x and AWS provider 5.x. Verify with your provider constraints.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: It provides patterns and examples only. It does not ship runnable modules or automation.

faq.question: How do I integrate this into my repo?
faq.answer: Adopt the module structure and copy patterns into your module directories and documentation.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No. It is documentation content without data access or network activity.

faq.question: What if module tests fail?
faq.answer: Check variable defaults, provider configuration, and example inputs. Ensure Terraform and providers are installed.

faq.question: How does it compare to module registries?
faq.answer: This focuses on patterns and structure. Registries provide ready made modules and versioned releases.
